gw.api.assignment

Class AssigneePicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.assignment.AssigneePicker

  • public class AssigneePicker
extends java.lang.Object
    Support for assignee picker, used to pick a user, group or queue to which a bean is going to be assigned. This object is used as a helper for PCF pages, to store an assignee picked from the resuls of an assignment search.

    If the current location has a "picker listener" set then setting the selected assignee will pick and pop the current location - that is it will pop the location and call the picker listener with the selected assignee. This is how the picker is usually used, both by the assignee picker window, which is used to pick another assignee value to add to a range input, and by the assignment popup which uses an assignee picker object if the user ignores the suggested assignee list and does an search instead.

    See Also:
    AssignmentPopup

      AssigneePicker(boolean includeQueues)
      Create a new, empty picker.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AssigneePicker

        public AssigneePicker(boolean includeQueues)
        Create a new, empty picker.
        Parameters:
        includeQueues - should the picker be allowed to search for queues? Set to false if assigning an assignable that cannot be assigned to queues.

    • Method Detail

      • getSelection

        public Assignee getSelection()
        The assignee selected by the user, or null if none selected. The assignee may be a UserAssignee (a wrapper around a group/user pair), a Group or an AssignableQueue.

      • setSelectedUser

        public void setSelectedUser(GroupUser user)
        Set the selected assignee to be the given group user. If the current location has a picker listener, then set the location's pick value to be this user assignee and commit the location.

      • getSelectedUser

        public GroupUser getSelectedUser()
        Returns the last GroupUser set as the selected assignee. Even if the selected assignee has been changed to a different type of assignee (such as a group) this method will still return the last GroupUser that was chosen.

      • setSelectedGroup

        public void setSelectedGroup(Group group)
        Set the selected assignee to be the given group. If the current location has a picker listener, then set the location's pick value to be this group and commit the location.

      • getSelectedGroup

        public Group getSelectedGroup()
        Returns the last Group set as the selected assignee. Even if the selected assignee has been changed to a different type of assignee (such as a queue) this method will still return the last Group that was chosen.

      • setSelectedQueue

        public void setSelectedQueue(AssignableQueue queue)
        Set the selected assignee to be the given queue. If the current location has a picker listener, then set the location's pick value to be this queue and commit the location.

      • getSelectedQueue

        public AssignableQueue getSelectedQueue()
        Returns the last Queue set as the selected assignee. Even if the selected assignee has been changed to a different type of assignee (such as a user) this method will still return the last Queue that was chosen.

      • setSelection

        public void setSelection(Assignee selection)
        Set the selected assignee and, if the current location has a picker listener, then set the location's pick value to be the assignee and commit the location.

      • getAllowedAssignmentSearchTypes

        public java.util.List getAllowedAssignmentSearchTypes()
        Return a list of AssignmentSearchTypes ("User", "Group" and "Queue") specifying the allowed types of assignee for this picker. This is needed because some assignables cannot be assigned to a queue, so the returned list will not include "Queue" if it is not appropriate.
